when they met, the boy launched the first hit at his face with his fist, making contact on his jaw. thinking he won. "really," the boy jumped. "fine, I do this the had way." holstering his guns, the boy pulled out a sword out from his back, the size of his arm. the blade looked like a wing of a dragon with a green eye in the gard. running tword the demon, he slashed a deep scarlet cut into the beasts chest. jumping back in front of the monster, he slashed upward, knocking it up into the air. going after it, the boy starts to slash and stab constantly before the demon started to fall. quickly holstering his sword, he pulls out his guns and starts unleash all of hell onto the monsters whole body, tearing it to shreds, leaving nothing but the pulp that landed on the ground and the sea of guts and blood.

11.content: As zsaag ran through the fields, holding his carbine close to his chest, he hoped to find shelter for the night. Getting to the bushes at the other end, zsaag crouched down, his breathing getting deeper and heavier. Looking back, he noticed that the drones were still following him. ‘Damn, I thought that I got rid of them.’ Putting his carbine on his back, he pulls around the Rossmore that he had with him. It came in handy when he was in empire, killing howlers and spider stalkers and the occasional grey jack that tried to get friendly with him. Jumping up and aiming his shot gun, zsaag thought that he could destroy the drones before they either kill him, or before they go to the Anthra and reporting his position, but there was one problem, the drones were gone. Looking all around his front, he couldn’t spot the flying killers anywhere. Sweat poured from his face as he searched, only to keep tripping over his own feet. As he kept looking, he started to hear a faint humming sound, this was zsaag’s new destination, ‘got ya.’ Running, zsaag got his Rossmore at the ready, the bullets eager to get out. Heading into the trees, the branches hitting his face and cutting it open, zsaag starts to get closer to humming, knowing that the drones were the source of the noise. When he got close enough, he could see the drones clearly, but one was down on the ground, and looked like it was destroyed when the other was hanging from a rope, half dead. “What the hell?” looking on the ground, zsaag saw that there were humans lying dead, all of them, slaughtered. ‘This is bad, this looks like Anthra, but not even those monsters would do something like this.’ Looking for any hint of what did this, he noticed that one of the bodies was still breathing, but barley. Rush over to help him, he notices that the boy was not even twenty. “Hey kid, you alright?” the body does not stir. “Damn.” Looking for any signs of Anthra, the boy in his arms began to wake. “Hey, you alright-“ zsaag was cut off. “G-G-Get out wh-while you can.” Zsaag couldn’t believe what he was hearing. ‘What kind of hell has he been through?’ before he could ask what happened, a blur went by his head. Looking for where it came from, zsaag could see a shadow in the tree. Looking down at the boy, he saw that what went past him was a piece of shrapnel that was thrown into the kids’ stomach. Barley breathing, the tried to get out one last word to him in desperation. “R-R-RUN FOR YOU-“ The boy stopped, his face frozen in fear as blood flowed from his mouth. Looking at his head, zsaag saw that another piece of metal was thrown into his skull. Looking back up at the shadow, it seemed to be laughing at the boys death, like it enjoyed it. “YOU BASTERED!!!!!” The figure kept laughing as it jumped down and ran into the trees for cover. Looking down at the boy who died, he could see that he was an innocent pawn in all this murder. Not able to hold it back, he let his tears flow from his eyes, his feelings taking over his mind. “RRRRRRAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHAAAAAAAAAA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!” As he yelled, the animals in the trees ran and flew away from the noise. When he was done yelling his lungs out, he hung his head in agony. Looking back up, his face was turned to stone, it showed no emotion what so ever. “I’ll kill you for that.” Laying the kid down, zsaag looked next to him and saw a Fareye sniper rifle. Placing both his Folsom carbine and Rossmore on his back, he slings the Fareye over his chest and grabs two 9mm and some ammo before dumping some fuel that was nearby onto the bodies of the humans, but he poured more fuel onto the boy that was killed in his arms. “I promise, I’ll kill that laughing prick in your name.” taking out a match, he thou it onto the bodies, setting them all ablaze. “And thanks for the rifle, I’ll put it to good use.” After giving them all uliagies, zsaag took one last look aat the fire and set off for the beast that killed them all.

111.content: Looking up at the building covered in snow before him, zsaag walked towered the old bus station with his Folsom M5A2 Carbine in his hands, covered in blood, and guts of point blank shots. On his back was his Rossmore shot gun and Fareye sniper rifle, all three eager and ready to kill whatever came at them. Walking up to the station door, he noticed that it was boarded up and chained shut to keep homeless out till someone buys the building. Taking out his Rossmore, zsaag put it up to the door, pulling the trigger; he blasted a round into the door, creating a new door for the station. Walking in, the first thing that noticed is that for a empty building, it was very well lighted with Anthra lighting. Taking his size thirteen boot, he placed it directly on the ten foot light, pushing it down. Not getting the results that he wanted, he decided to fire a round in the air. Waiting, he finally heard what he wanted, the growl of monsters. Loading some rounds in the Rossmore, zsaag lifted the gun up to his eye level. “I’m home.” Out of nowhere, an Anthra popped up in front of him, baring its teeth at him, only to have his head blown to bits. “Come on!” getting his wish, the whole nest of Anthra showed up, baring claws, teeth, guns and B.O. to back them up. Smiling, zsaag swung his Rossmore behind him and pulled out his Carbine and let hell out. Round after round, stink after stink, he made his way through to the only goal that he had at the moment. Soon after he got past the ticket counter, the Anthra pulled out the big guns. Standing before him was a howler. A beast that looked like a baby Godzilla, only was red and black, had horns on his head, and its breath was toxic to humans. The one thing that gave it a edge was the fact that it had no eyes, it see’s with its tongue. And the reason that it was called a howler was of its horrible howl that it made when it found food or needed help. As zsaag faced the beast, the howler stuck its tongue out, liking the air. Turning to him, the monster let out its blood curdling howl as it ran, mouth open, at zsaag. Rolling to the side, zsaag aimed his Carbine at the monsters head and let loss on the monstrosity, shredding the things head. Thinking that he killed the howler, zsaag smiles triumphantly as he headed off to the back door when he stopped, getting a feeling that something was not right. Looking back zsaag saw that that the howler that he killed, was fixing its self, the fragments of its head, was returning back to the spots that they belong. ‘Hmm.’ putting back his Folsom and taking back out his Rossmore, zsaag went back up to the howler, his thoughts racing. “You just won’t die, will you?” The howler responded him with a shout of its own. “Well then, come gets some!” as soon as he said that, the howler went running up to him, it’s green breath visible to zsaag. But he didn’t move. Instead, he just stood in that one spot, his gun at his hip. ‘Come on, hit me…..’ As the beast got closer, his finger slowly tightened around the trigger, his patience wearing thin. Finally, the howler reaches him, as the thing was about to close its jaws around his body, zsaag pulled the trigger, unleashed the round that was inside the Rossmore, splitting its head into pieces again. As same as before, the fragments started to go back to their original spots. Looking at the ground, zsaag noticed that one piece was under his foot. Picking it up, took out a grenade and strapped it to the skull fragment, releasing the trigger on the bomb. As the skull piece went back, he wondered if this would work. Once it was back, the howler growled at him, but in the middle of its growl, zsaag heard a small ping inside of the things head. What followed it was a explosion, busting open the howlers head form the inside. zsaag waited for the thing to regenerate, but it never did. Smiling, he took his Rossmore and reloaded it, knowing that he would need it. Taking back out his Folsom, zsaag went into the garage and looked around. Only finding papers and blood spate walls, he decided that what he was looking for wasn’t hear. Just as he was about to leave, a silver blur went past his head, landing into the desk behind him. Looking at the object, zsaag saw that it was a piece of shrapnel, ‘got ya, you little prick!’ Looking at the spot from where it had been thrown, zsaag saw that it was a Anthra that had thrown it, the same one that he swore to kill. Running up the stairs, zsaag tried to get the second floor, hoping that it was still there. Upon reaching the next floor, he saw that the thing wasn’t there. “Damn it.” Looking outside, zsaag saw that the stink was standing outside in the snow, with a smirk on its face. “He wants me to follow, he’s going to wish he stayed inside.” kicking the window open, he jumped down to the ground, his fall softened by the fall. Once down there, zsaag looked around for the stink. But to no avail. “Damn, where’d he go?” after some time, zsaag finally got his answer. Listening, he could hear giant steps in the distance. Heading in the direction of the of the sound, zsaag was soon at the top of a snow covered hill, but whatever made that sound was nowhere in sight. ‘Now where could it have gone?’ suddenly, the ground under him started to rumble and shatter under his feet. Then out of nowhere, the ground beneath him imploded outward under him. Landing on his back, zsaag looked up at the spot that he was on to find that a titan was in its spot, with the Anthra that he was looking for. A titan is a massive Anthra, over ten feet tall, huge arms and legs, with a withered fox head. In their hands is always a RPG that they sometimes use to beat their enemies to death with. As the Anthra at the top of its head shouted orders in its own language to the titan, the beast let out its RPG, firing down upon zsaag like lightning. Taking cover, zsaag opened up onto the titan with his Folsom, firing round after round at the beasts body, only to have the shots bounce back and nearly hit him. ‘Damn, this thing just won’t get hurt. Everything I throw at it just comes back.’ Not wanting to do it, zsaag takes his gun and aims it directly at the titans head. Using the grenade launcher on it, he fired one single shot at the things head. What surprised him was that it did not come back at him. Instead, it exploded on the titans face, leaving a black face behind. Now knowing, zsaag let loss all of the clip that was in the rifle into the things head, jumping out of the way of oncoming rockets. Once it was down on its knees, zsaag ran up to its head, with his Rossmore in hand, and held the gun to its temple. Pulling the trigger, he unleashed both barrels into the titan’s skull, killing it. Looking around the body of the titan, zsaag found no sign of the Anthra that was riding it. Looking at the top of the head, he saw what a trail of blood looked. Following it, zsaag found what he was looking for. The Anthra that he had followed to the station, but the thing wasn’t jumping away, it was crawling, its legs blown away. “Sweet, sweet karma.” Walking up to the stink that was crawling, with his Rossmore in hand, zsaag stood above it, his gun pointed at its skull. “Now how do you feel? You can’t fight, can’t move, just like the kid you killed.” As he spoke, he slowly forced his gun into the Anthra’s skull, causing it to bleed. “I’m going to do the same thing that you did to that kid, but before I do,” he lifted his gun. “ Any last words.” The stink didn’t speak. Instead, he spat on zsaag’s shoes. “ So be it.” Putting the gun back in its skull, zsaag slowly pulled the trigger. When it was finally pulled, the Anthra’s head became a dish for the snow. “Now to finish this.” Going back over to the titan, zsaag grabbed the gun that held and fired one rocket at the station, setting it ablaze. As he watched the fire, a man walked up next to him, with a cigar in his mouth. “Nice work, you did this in no less than an hour.” Zsaag looked over to him. “What do you want?” the fat man laughed. “To offer you a prize. But first, have you heard of project stink?”

1111.content:
As the boy lay strapped to the table, men in white looked down upon their faces covered by masks. As he struggled at his binds, he yelled and cursed the names of the men he saw. One man walked up to him, holding a syringe filled with a blue liquid. As the man neared with the needle, the boy nearly lunged at the man, only to come up short, for he still laid bind to the table. Once the needle was in the boys arm, he slowly started to calm, his eyes, becoming half shut, barley able to see what was going on. “He’s down, you can let them in now.” Drifting his head over, he could see that two people came into the room. One male, one female. “He’s is in a very violent state now. The only way to put him under was do what we call is “life over death”. He is now in a very deep sleep, but it won’t last long, so I suggest that you make it brief.” The man and woman walked over to him, the women was in tears for some reason, he felt that he should help her, but his body wouldn’t move. “Son, if you can hear us, we want you to know that we love you and that were doing this for your safety and are own.” The man said. The boy just lay there, staring up at him, wondering why this man was calling him son, yet he felt that it was right. One of the men in white came up to the couple, gesturing them out. “Mr. and Mrs. Redgarve, you have to leave now, we are about to do the operation on him now.” With that, the two were gone. ‘Wait, don’t leave me here!’ As the men put needles in his arms, three men came in; wearing what looked like military uniforms. “Doctor Higgins, where is this new test subject that you promised me?” the biggest officer said. One man looked over his shoulder to see the man. “Ah, general Starch, so good to see you. The boy is right here on the table.” Referring to the half out boy. The general studied him for a seconded, looking over his whole being. “Kind of scrawny isn’t it?” He asked. Higgins laughed. “Yes, well, the experiment will make him stronger than he looks to let you know, so you won’t have worry about that.” The general still didn’t believe him. “What about his parents?” the doctor laughed again. “Well then we will just tell them that it didn’t work and that he could still kill them.” The general nodded in agreement. “Proceed Doctor.” Once he heard this, Higgins reached for the saw that lay on the tool table, and started to cut the boys head open. ‘Hey, stop that! It hurts! I can still feel it!’ But the boy’s body didn’t move, it just laid there on the table, stiffer than a rock. After Higgins stopped cutting into the boy’s skull, blood flowed over the child’s head, into his eyes. “Now that we have cut through his skull, we may now implant the wires to his lobs.”
Higgins was overjoyed by this. No test subject has ever made it this far. The boy looked at the doctor with half open eyes, like he was looking into his soul. ‘What are you doing to me? What did I do?’ With his lips curling back, Doctor Higgins took two wires, showing them to the boy. “Look, you’re the only one to make it this far and, well, live.” The boy didn’t reply, well, not physically. ‘What are you talking about? What are you doing to me, it hurts!’ Inserting the wires, Doctor Higgins attached them to what looked like a monitor, turning knobs and throwing switches on the control panel. Sending electric shocks to the boy’s brain. “This general, will let him know that if he does something that we don’t what him to do, we will send a painful shock through his system.” The general was pleased with what the doctor was doing. He may very well get his weapon after all. “But,” the doctor added. “this may take awhile.” This displeased the general. “Why doctor?” Higgins ran to the other side of the table, afraid that he was going to be hit. “Since the subject has lasted this far, it may take awhile for him to submit and to alter his DNA.” Starch sighed. This is not what he wanted to hear. “It better be worth the wait.” And with that, Higgins went back to work.
It’s been several months since Higgins has seen the general. His work with the boy has come a long way. As he works on the boy, general Starch came in. “How’s it coming Higgins?” The doctor was delighted to see the general had stop by. “Come see for yourself.” Referring to the object on the table. As the general walked over to the table, he could see that the cloth that had been placed on top of him was moving up and down. A sign that he was alive. Once he reached the table, Higgins slowly removed the cloth to reveal what looked to be a corps. “What is this Higgins? The morgue!” Doctor Higgins chuckled to hearing this. “No general, this is what I have done so far.” On the table, lay the body of the boy who he had taken from the Redgarves a few months back. Only there were a few things different. His skin, for one thing, was no longer a healthy tan, glowing with personality, but now a ghostly white; it looked like he was almost transparent. His finger nails were now black, and somewhat charred from Higgins experiments. The boys lips were also black now as well, sealed shut by a glue put on his lips earlier. And lastly from what the general saw, was that the boys hair, what used to be a light brown oak, was now snow white, and down to his shoulders. The way he looked was just alien to Starch. As he took one last look over the body, Starch noticed that the wrist cuffs that were supposed to hold the boy down were open. “Why are his cuffs open like that?” Higgins looked down at the table and smiled. “Don’t worry, he’s down, he can’t hurt you.” Doctor Higgins spoke to soon, because as soon as he said that, the boy’s eyes opened. Turning his head, the boy looked into the generals eyes, as if he was talking to his soul. When Starch saw the boy’s eyes, he nearly broke out into a cold sweat. What he saw was not human. This child had emerald green eyes that could calm the most savage hearts, now which was replaced with deathly golden yellow eyes, and the whiteness of his eyes was now a deep black. “Why is his eyes open? And why do they look like that?” Doctor Higgins looked down at the body like it was a thing and didn’t matter. “Oh, he does that sometimes.” Starch still thought that the way that his eyes were the scariest thing that he ever saw. “Why are his eyes like that? And his, well, everything?” Doctor Higgins looked down at the boy and grinned. “You like? I got the idea from a show that my son watches. His eyes are like that because if you are on the battle field and you saw this young man’s eyes? What would you think? That death is at your door, or you need new pants.” He pointed at the boy’s body. “I choose this because of all the things that you can do with it. His skin is like an iron hide, and can give perfect camouflage in dust storms, snow and other scenarios. “His hair is the same thing with the camo.” Looking down at his eyes, Higgins poked the blackened area. “His eyes can also see in the dark, while his ears have been strengthening to the sensitivity of a million dogs!” Higgins screamed as loud as he could, afraid that no one would hear it. “And I believe that this is my greats work yet sir!” Starch took one last look at the boy before the cloth was put back over him. “How much longer till he’s done?” Higgins thought about this for a moment, putting all the numbers together. “About a few more years.” A lab assistant came running up to Higgins, out of breath. “Sir, the Redgarves are here to see you.” Higgins nodded and the assistant left. “Time to get rid of a problem now.” At the far end of the lab, two people came in. Mr. and Mrs. Redgarve. “Aw, how delighted to see you both. How are you?” Higgins asked. “We really just came here to see if our son is alright now.” Mr. Redgarve said, his voice deepened from the moths that his son has been here. “Well, your son has shown no sign of change. I’m afraid that he was a fail.” Higgins tried to say without laughing. “But can we see him?” Mrs. Redgarve Higgins thought about this for no longer than a split second. “No.” This angered Mr. Redgarve. “Why!?” Higgins let out his laugh, no longer able to hold it in. “Because he is no longer your son.” This made Mrs. Redgarve furious not able to see her child. “WHERE IS HE YOU WORM!!!?” Now the good doctor was scared, but then he got a really great idea. “Well, if you want to see him, then come to the table…” Higgins was eager to see what would happen. As Mr. Redgarve headed over to the table, he could see the cloth on it rise and fall, thinking that it was his son. When he reached the table, Mr. Redgarve could just barely make out what was under the cloth. Taking it off, Mr. Redgarve saw what looked like a dead albino. “What kind of sick joke is this? Where is he?” Doctor Higgins couldn’t help but smile, this was going better than he could predict. “This is your son. We had to change him up to make the, um, process to work right.” Mr. Redgarve had heard enough. Tightening his fists, he ran over to Higgins, fist ready to strike, only to be cut short by his wife, who had her hands balled up, and egger to tear his face off. Knocking Higgins onto his back, Mrs. Redgarve began to punch furiously at his face, leaving bloody pools all over. Higgins was now scared for his life, it looked like it was going to end for him. But he had an idea. “Yont, wake up, I need you.” On the table, the boy that laid there was now standing up, looking at the woman on the doctor. “Get her off me!” When Higgins looked back at the table, he could see that the child was no longer on the table. Looking back at Mrs. Redgarve, he saw the boy, standing over her. Lifting her by the waist, the boy took her away from the bruised doctor. Setting her down on the floor, the boy looked down upon her, wondering why she looked familiar. “Kill them.” Higgins said, his face, covered in purple. The boy stood there, his golden globes staring off into Mrs. Redgarves eyes. “I said kill them now!”But the boy did not move. He felt as if she was something to him. “Tony, it’s me, your mother. Don’t you remember?” ‘I know you, but, who are you? You say that you’re my mother, but are you?’ As he reached his hand out to her, Mr. Redgarve could see Higgins reaching for a button. “Hey, stop!” but he was too late. Higgins activated the electric nodes in his brain, sending a 5000 volt shock through his body. As he screamed in pain, Mr. Redgarve ran over to Higgins, lunging at him, knocking him down. The remote that held the boy to Higgins, was dropped, and skidded across the floor. Mr. Redgarve saw an opening and dove for the remote, hopping to turn the tide, only to be stopped by the albino boy, whose foot was crushing his hand. “Now this is more like it,” Higgins laughed. “Now, let’s try this again, kill him.” Mr. Redgarve looked up in the boys eyes, to see nothing. No sadness, no anger, only fear. Lifting Mr. Redgarve up by his throat, the boy slowly tightened his grip, his black nails into Mr. Redgarves neck, blood started to flow. The albino, throwing his prey, began to smile. Walking over to where Mr. Redgarve fell, he could see where his fingers were, the blood print of his hand stained Mr. Redgarves neck. For some reason, this made the boy even happier. Standing over the old man’s limp body, the boy raised his foot over Mr. Redgarve head. As he looked down at his terrified face, a twisted grin appeared on the boys face, as if he was enjoying this. The last thing that Mr. Redgarve saw was his son’s foot, and then, blackness. Mrs. Redgarve just sat there, watching her former son, wiping the blood off his shoe. Soon, the boy looked over at her, with the same look in his eyes as before. As he walked over to her, Mrs. Redgarve slowly stood up, hoping to make a bluff that would get him to stop. But it didn’t work, for the boy continued to approach her, his lips curled back in a twisted smile. When he was close enough, the boy stared into her eyes, his golden globes piercing her soul. As she was about to tell him that she loved him, the boy thrusted his hand into her stomach, his hand flat and ripping her stomach open. Forcing his hand farther in, Mrs. Redgarve fell over his shoulder, her eyes blank. The boy liked how this felt. The sensation of warm blood flowing through his hands. Taking his hand out, the boy lets Mrs. Redgarve fall to the floor, her body still. As he looked over her, Higgins took the remote and activated the probes in the boys head, causing the boy to scream in pain. Soon the boy could not handle it, and feel over, submitting to the pain. “That’s a good boy.” Higgins said. “That was not how I wanted you to get rid of them.” Starch was standing at the other side of the room, very displeased. “Don’t worry sir, we can have this fixed in no time.” Starch was still impressed with the overall test that was, unnecessarily conducted. “The boy still has a few bugs to work out. But don’t-“ Starch held up his hand. “Just get it done.” And with that, he walked away.

The world of Sufira

In the world of Sufira, monsters and humans coexist together. One hating the other. But there is a catch, the monsters can be caught and taught how to protect and fight for you. Or to be your friend and help you. This guide is to help you understand the world you live in and live a longer life, not in a monsters belly.

When you go out into the world, you need to know a few things.
One- you need to know how to fight. If you don’t know how to fight, then you can’t defend yourself if a monster jumps out in front of you.

Two- you need a summon-stone. Before you head out on your own, you need to have a partner. Summon-stones are monsters that have been forced into a soul-gem by the means of magic or science. You will learn about soul-steeling later. You will learn about the way a summon works later.

Three- you need a scanner. There are two kinds of scanners, the hand held and the gauntlet. You will learn about scanners later.

Four- you need to have graduated from school. Summon-school is a mandatory for all hunters to accomplish before you can go out and look for summons. You will learn more about this later.

Five- you need Soul-gems. Soul-gems are round and can hold monsters in them, which become summons. You will learn more later.

Summon-school
Before you go out and hunt your first monster, you need to have an education. And what better place to get that then your local Summon-school. When in school, you will be taught the basics. How to fight, how to catch a monster, how the sealing of the monster works, ect. You also have basic classes, like science, gym, and English. But your main classes are to teach you about your summons that you will work for. There is one thing you need to know, the outfit that you show up in on your first day, will be your school uniform.

Fighting-
When searching for a monster, you need to have the right skills and uniform. Most hunters, the ones who hunt the monsters, go with basic hunting gear. Basic hunting gear comes equipped with a tracer that locks on to a monster and tracks it with a push of a button. The basic gear is light weight and allows mobility. But most common gear is heavy and limits mobility, but has great defense. But the younger hunter often want to look good and ‘fly’, so they wear light weight cloths. When fighting a summon, most people use a sword, to get the feeling that their ancestors had. But now a day, hunters use a gun to take down a monster. But bullets can’t always go through a scaly or leathery hide. So a sword has to be kept with you when hunting, for safety reasons.

Soul-gem-
A soul gem is a stone that is basically an empty shell till a monster becomes sealed inside. When a monster is sealed away, it becomes a summon. The way that a Soul-gem captures a monster, is by two ways. The first way is by magic. The way that the magic works is by reciting the steal-spell. The seconded way is by Science. The way that this is done by the scanner gauntlet. You will learn about this later.

Summon-stone-
The Summon-stone, the thing of mysteries. A summon-stone holds only one summon at a time. When you use a summon, you must call it out, by lifting it above your head and calling out the summons name. Summon-stones come in a variety of colors-

Red
Blue
Green
Gold
Black
White
Pink
Red-the beginner level of a summon.

Blue-the novice level of a summon.

Green-the intermediate level of a summon.

Gold-the master level of a summon.

There are special summons in the world of Sufira. The colors of these summonses are black, white, and pink.

Black-black summon-stones are dark monsters that have been sealed away by the forces of nature or by holy monsters. It is very rare to find a dark monster not in its stone form. When approaching a dark monster, use caution, for they are known to be very deadly.
White- White summon-stones are holy monsters. Holy monsters are sent to protect humans and normal monsters from dark monsters. If a dark monster bites a human or a monster, then it becomes a dark monster as well. Holy monsters are extremely rare to find in stone form. But you can find them at churches and others sacred grounds.

Now, for the most dangerous summon of all.
Pink- the pink summon-stone is common and very dangerous to have. Pink summons are known as; ‘Mother-stones’. Mother-stones are monsters that are all female and act like a mother. Mother-stones have only a few moods, which you will learn about later, the moods are: loving, caring, protective, forcing, needing, and wanting. These moods are only for mother-stones. If a mother-stone has been summoned, the stone will vanish and the summon cannot be sent back. If you ever come across a Mother-stone, you must run. You are not allowed to kill a Mother-stone, for they are more advanced than a normal summon. Mother-stones can break free of the holds of their stones and become people, have kids, and make families, even with humans. When the first Mother-stones became free and made families, they went to court and fought for their rights. When they won they made it clear to take any Mother-stones they find to the nearest summon fillers so it can be given to the Mother-stone realists. You are not to kill any Mother-stone you find, for it is against the law.

There are a few summonses that are called ‘The forgivers’. The forgivers are the gods of the summons. There are only three forgivers, they come from the darkness, the light, and Mother-stones. The forgivers,(in the same order.) are chaos, cosmos, and the flower spirit.

Summonses have three forms. Attack, rest, and chibi. When they are in attack, they are ready for a battle. Rest is when they are in the stone. And chibi is when they are out and about.
Chibi is a smaller form of a summon. It is a, what some say, cuter form of a summon.

Moods- moods are the way that a summon acts. There are several moods to summons; happy, energetic, feisty, sleepy, sad, anger, hatred, guilt, protective, loving, evil and good.

There are some cases that a Mother-stone has a child. When a Mother-stone has a child with a human, the child is half monster and half human, meaning that the child can be caught and turned in to a summon. If you are one of those kids, then be very careful who you tell who you are. For you may be double crossed and sucked into a Soul-gem. Kids who are the offspring of a Mother-stone and a human have powers and can do amazing things. Scientist have tried to give people the powers of summons, but failed to do so without a Mother-stone. And they have tried to dissect the children of Mother-stones to get the DNA of the summons to make the dream possible. If you are caught, this may happen to you.

Well, that’s about it. Other than what I just told you, you are on your own for now.

School is never fun, especially for the new kid. For a new kid, the school is boot camp. You don’t know anyone, you can’t find your classes, you don’t know your teachers, and you don’t even know where the bathrooms are. My name is Zane, and this is how my day started, and ended. A nightmare, and now a dream come true. I started the year with no friends, and ended up with a friend for life.
As I walked up to the school, I could smell the fear and shame radiate off the evil building, somewhere on the other side of school, I could hear a child scream for his life. This was the same way that every school looks like, frightening and bone chilling. As I walk in, I could smell death and old people the moment I open the doors. Going up to the office, I could see the lady behind the desk, working on her nails. Without looking up, she handed me a slip of paper. To my surprise, it had my name on it.
“Your first class is in five minutes. Don’t be late.” This woman said this without looking up from her nails.
I shuddered the moment that I got away. I still wonder how she knew who I was, or if it was by a stroke of luck. As I walk down the hall, I could see that all the kids were paying no mind to me as I walk down to class. Suddenly, the bell rings, and the halls were empty in 0.5 seconds, leaving me alone.
I found my class, after I wondered around the school for hours (Actually, about 15 minutes.). When I walked in the door, the teacher stopped what he was doing and looked over at me with his dark green eyes.
“Are you Zane?” He said, rather than asking. I nodded, for fear had stolen my voice.
“Come over here.” He told me to stand next to him; I did as I was told, for I knew that if I didn’t, he may have done something.
“Class, we have a new student today, please welcome, Zane,” The teacher stopped, and I knew why.
“Knights.”
The teacher looked down at me, with his emotionless face. “Thank you.” He said.
“Zane is all the way from Rome, and is new here, so you are to make him feel comfortable.” He looked over to a group of boys. “No cakes like last time either. We don’t want another law suit again.” The group of boys laughed.
The teacher sighed and turned back to me. “My name is Mr. Raven, I will be your history teacher for first hour.” He handed me a sheet of paper. “You may sit in any seat that is not taken. And do hurry.”
Taking my seat, I looked at the sheet that he had given me. I had information on the Aztecs and some Spanish guy. I had no clue what they were doing.
“Need some help?” The girls next to me asked. I looked up to meet he gaze, to be met with a big pair of dark brown eyes. “My names Julie.” She held out her hand. “May I see your paper?” I handed my sheet to her. As she took it, I could smell her sweet perfume. As she looked it over, I couldn’t help but look her over as well. Julie looked about 5’7, black hair with streaks of purple, and wore dark clothing and jeans. I thought she was beautiful, but I would never tell her that. Not yet anyway.
“This is about when Cortez concord the Aztecs.” Said Julie as she handed me back the paper. “May I see your schedule?” complying, I reach into my backpack and take out my schedule, giving it to her. Julie looks it over and gives it back to me. “We have all the same classes. So I can show you where your classes are.”
Julie lead me all over the school, she even paid for my lunch. After school, she took me to her home, which wasn’t that far from my house. When we got to her house, I found my parents visiting with Julie’s family. Things were pretty quiet for the most part for the rest of the night, my dad made friends with Julie’s dad really fast and my mother and Julie’s became rivals in almost everything, I met Julie’s sister, Crystal. When Julie introduced me to her, I overheard her say that I’m cute, which made Julie punch her. I’m not the best looking guy, my silver hair and my dark clothes usually tend to make people stay away. But maybe this might happen here.
After dinner, Julie’s parents suggested that I stay over at her house for the night, so she can show me around town. After a quick tour, I and Julie get ready for bed. As I lie in bed, I started to smell something coming from Julie’s room. Ignoring it, I went back to bed.
The next morning, I felt very sore for some odd reason, like I lifted rocks all day. Trying to stand, I fell forward on my face, trying to stand again, I got the hang of it, but it felt wrong for some reason. Looking around, I noticed that the room was a lot larger than what I remember. Suddenly, the door opened, to reveal Julie’s mom, Maria Sanders.
“Zane, are you up? It’s time for breakfast.” Maria looked around for me but didn’t find me.
“Down here Mrs. Sanders.” She looked down, for a minute she didn’t see me. But when she did, she screamed for Julie. When Julie got in the room, she asked Maria what was wrong; all she got was her mother pointing down at me. When Julie saw me, she screamed.
“What? What’s wrong?”
Maria went over to the desk that was in the room and took the mirror off it and placed it in front of me. What I saw shocked me. My body was no longer human, but the body of a cat, a small house cat.
“Wha-what happened to me?!” I tried to stand on my hind legs, but ended up falling over, getting a giggle out of the two girls above him.
“This isn’t funny you guys!” I yelled at them. They stopped laughing, a giggle escaped every now and then. The noise from Julie and her mom combined lead Crystal to leave her room and see what was so funny. When she saw me, she immediately bent down and picked me up and started to coo and aw me.
“Did you do it again Julie?” Crystal asked, looking over to her sister. Julie nodded.
“It may have been what I was working on last night.” Before Julie could say another thing, an alarm went off thought the house. This made the girls go nuts.
“Were late for school!” Crystal yelled, nearly breaking my small eardrums. Julie and crystal scrambled all over the house, getting on cloths, eating food, and grabbing backpacks before Julie finally realized something important.
“What about Zane? He can’t go to school as a cat!” This became a problem that happened naturally later in my life. Then Maria smiled.
“He will just have to stay here till Julie can fix this.” The three of us looked at Maria with a puzzled look.
“He can’t go like how he is, so he can stay here. He can keep me company.” Crystal and Julie looked at each other and smiled.
“That could work.” Said Julie. So with it decided, the girls went to school, leaving me with Maria all day.
I didn’t really go outside of the room for most of the day. I spent most of the time trying to get the hang of walking, and learned that cats can’t use toilets. So Maria put in a cat box for me, I don’t even know why they had one in the first place. At some point during the day, I eventually went out the door and into the living room, to see what Maria was doing. She was sitting on the couch folding cloths while watching the news. As I walked over, I noticed that Maria hadn’t seen me yet, so I decided to surprise her. Jumping up, I walked up to her; she was still focused on the T.V. and the cloths in front of her.
“Hi.” Maria jumped when she heard me, for I think that she forgot that I was here.
“Zane, I forgot you were here,” I knew it.
“Can I get you something?” after she said that, my very small stomach roared as if on cue.
“Maybe something to eat?” she said, trying not to laugh. This made me blush, or I would have if I didn’t have fur on my face. Maria got up and went into the kitchen, with me following. Getting on the table, I watched her take out a can of tuna and empty it onto a plate, and place it in front of me. As soon as it was on the table, I heard my belly growl for the food. I bent down and devoured the food, satisfying my belly’s hunger.
When she finished cleaning the plate, the two of us went back to the living room. As she folded cloths, I lay beside her, and watched her fold. When she was done, she lifted me up and placed me on her lap. I was about say something when she started petting me, which, for some reason, felt really good. As I was being petted, I could feel sleep take over, I decided not to fight it and went to sleep. It wasn’t long before I awoke to Julie and Crystal standing over me, smiling.
“Well, how was your day?” They asked at the same time. I simply nodded, for there was nothing to say.
“Well,” Julie started, before she lifted me up to her face. “I think it’s time to get you back to your human form Zane.”
Taking me up to her room, Julie placed me on her bed, and take out a pot from her closet, setting it on the floor. Next she filled the pot with strange colored water that kind of smelled like burnt hair. She then reached over behind her and grabbed a vile of white powder and sprinkled a small amount of it into the liquid.
“Kay, get in.” She said, getting out a pointed hat and a black cloak.
“What?” I asked her. She got that annoyed look that only woman can do, I’ve seen my mother do it many times.
“You heard me, in the pot, unless you want to stay a cat.” She had a stick in her hand that looked like it had been burnt at the tip. Jumping down, I made my way over to the vat of goop, only to be snatched up by Julie and dumped in, nearly drowning.
“What was that for? You could have killed me!” I snapped at her, which only got her laughing.
“You’re so cute when you’re mad. Maybe I should keep you.” Said Julie as she reached out to lift me out of the pot.
“No!” I screamed as I ducked away from her hands.
“Then let me finish.” Keeping quiet, I let her finish what she was doing, which put a funny leaf on my head. After she did that, she took a stance and started to mumble something under her breath in Latin. Before she could finish, Crystal burst into the room, with my clothes in her arms.
“Hey, Jules, here’s his clothes.” She placed them on her bed. “Just so things don’t get weird.” Crystal looked down at me and giggled. “A shame he won’t stay in this form. I really wanted a cat.” And then she walked out the room.
“Well, if there are no more interruptions, I would like to finish my spell.” Said Julie complaining. That was when I put it together. She was a witch. That smell that I got came from this pot.
Returning where she left off, she continued speaking in Latin for about a good long five minutes when she pointed the stick at my face. When she did, I felt a small tingle form in my nose, causing me to sneeze into the water, and for some reason, a cloud of dust shot up and out of the pot, covering my tiny body. When the dust cleared, my line of sight was higher than what it was before. Looking down, I could see my human hands and legs again. But one thing was wrong, I still needed my clothes. Looking around, I couldn’t find Julie anywhere.
“Get dressed pleased!” I heard her say form the bathroom. I did as I was told and got my cloths all on in less than a minute. Once all my clothes were on, Julie came out of the bathroom, her face very red.
“Are you clothed?” She asked without looking up.
“Yes, you can look up now.” When she did, I could tell that she was embarrassed about almost seeing me without my clothes. I laughed, which made her very mad.
“You know I could have left you furry ya’ know!” Julie was very upset at me for laughing at her.
“Sorry, just thought it was funny that you’re turning red.” Before she could answer, Maria called from downstairs.
“Zane, your mom here!” This interruption left both Julie and me redder than turnips.
“Um, here.” Julie handed me a folder with papers inside it.
“There what we covered in are classes. You’ll need to make up a quiz in math. And Mr. Raven needs you to take a test to see how much you know on Monday.”
“That’s right, tomorrow is Saturday.” With that, I left her house. When I got home, I couldn’t stop thinking about what happened in Julie’s room. I found out that she’s a witch, and that she might like me. That was a lot to take in at the time, my heart was pumping fast. Julie was one of the most beautiful girls I had ever set my eyes on, and she’s the first that hasn’t gotten scared of him, she was a witch, she could probably could’ve have killed me if she ever gotten mad at me, yet she got mad the whole time that I was in her room, and I lived. Maybe Julie is the one for me. Suddenly the phone downstairs rang.
“Zane,” My mother called. “It’s for you; it’s your new friend. She sounds nervous.” Going down stairs, I took the phone from my mom.
“Yell’lo?”
“Zane?” Julie asked. Mom was right, she did sound nervous.
“Yes, what’cha wants Jules? Something wrong?” I heard a sigh on her side of the phone.
“There’s something I want to talk to you about, can you meet me tomorrow?”
“Yeah, sure. Where do you want to meet?” I didn’t get a reply right away.
“By the lake, where the park is. Can we meet there?” She sounded scared now.
“Yeah, I can meet you there.”
That night was the longest night I had ever to wait through. I was somewhat excited and frightened about seeing her. What if see was going to erase my memory? Or do something worse to me? The power of fear was not in control, nor was any other emotion in my body. It was something else, something I couldn’t understand. Eventually, I fell asleep, but dreamt about me and Julie, but we didn’t look the way we do now, we, looked older.
The next day, Julie waited at the lake for me like she said she would. I decided to drive there in my car, my piece of crap car. My car was a Mazda, one of the first Mazda’s, so I can call it crap. Anyway, getting out, I made way over to Julie, who was wearing a white dress with blue flowers on it with her hair pulled back into a ponytail.
“Zane, I’m glad you came.”
